p: (iii) the dichloromethane/methanol extracts of plants traditionally used to treat oral infections, including Vachellia karroo (Hyane) Banfi & Galasso (synonym of Acacia karroo Hayne) (leaves; Fabaceae), Erythrina lysistemon Hutch (bark; Fabaceae), Spyrostachys africana Sond. (leaves; Euphorbiaceae), Tecoma capensis (Thumb.) Lindl., (leaves; Bignoniaceae) and Tarchonanthus camphoratus L. (leaves; Asteraceae), at a concentration of 250 Âµg/mL, showed antibiofilm activity against S. mutans ATCC 25175, known to be responsible for dental caries, with 59%, 68%, 86%, 52%, and 54% inhibition, respectively [ 59];
